definition: to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display

sentences.english: The portrait, painted in a simple but elegant style, has a romantic flavor.
sentences.chinese: 畫面墨淡氣雅，設色頗有浪漫主義韻味。

sentences.english: In the Dunhuang mural paintings, there exists a great amount of information about coloring practices during and before Tang dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 敦煌的壁畫保存了大量唐及唐以前的繪畫設色資料。

sentences.english: The difficulties of colouring a map rest mainly on the vagueness in the colour perception.
sentences.chinese: 地圖設色之困難，在於色彩感受的不確定性。

sentences.english: The Yangjiabu's board pictures are discussed in the area of the region, subject matter and color.
sentences.chinese: 探討楊家埠木版年畫的色彩特徵與設色規律。

definition: vertical scroll (painting or calligraphy)/vertical shaft (of a machine)
Chang Dai-chien or Zhang Daqian (1899-1983), one of the greatest Chinese artists of the 20th century
blue-and-green landscape (genre of landscape painting originating in the Tang dynasty, in which blues and greens predominate)
fine writing paper, originally from Jing county 涇縣|泾县, Xuancheng 宣城, Anhui
to sketch from nature/to do a still life drawing
printing plate bearing an image (illustration, photo etc)/print made with such a plate
